required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Collection of Biological Data With Potential Prognostic Relevance in Patients With MYELODYSPLASTIC SYNDROMES
clinical_study.official_title: Collection of Biological Data With Potential Prognostic Relevance in Patients With MYELODYSPLASTIC SYNDROMES

brief_summary.textblock: The present study is designed to determine the mutational status of markers (TET2 and PLCb2, cytogenetic aberrations) together with methylation status of the above genes using bone marrow and matched buccal cell samples from MDS patients who necessitate to start a treatment (i.e. EPO, Lenalidomide, Azacytidine). All patients included in the study will be followed for at least 2 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Analyze the incidence of TET2 gene mutations and Validation of the prognostic potential of TET2 mutations and MPLA screening
primary_outcome.description: Analyze the incidence of TET2 gene mutations in a series of MDS patients and describe the clinical status of patients carrying mutations Validation of the prognostic potential of TET2 mutations and MPLA screening on: Response rate to treatment with Epo, Lenalidomide and Azacitidine Progression Free Survival (PFS )

secondary_outcome.measure: Validation of the prognostic potential of TET2 mutations

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with MDS according to FAB, WHO and IPSS classifications. Patients who necessitate to start a treatment (i.e. EPO, Lenalidomide, Azacytidine).

biospec_descr.textblock: bone marrow and buccal cell samples

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with MDS detected by current diagnostic techniques (i.e., peripheral blood cytopenia, bone marrow morphology, cytogenetics andFISH analysis).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent
- Patients diagnosed with MDS according to FAB, WHO and IPSS classifications
- All clinically treatable MDS patients with EPO or Lenalidomide or 5-Azacytidine;
- Hb < 10 g/dL
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Gender: Male or Female
- Sufficient amount of biological samples for molecular studies
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Patients who do not require treatment on "watch and wait" strategy
- Insufficient amount of biological samples for molecular studies
